title: 90/631/Euratom, ECSC, EEC: Commission Decision of 30 November 1990 amending decision 89/196/EEC, Euratom, ECSC laying down detailed rules for the declassification of documents covered by professional or business secrecy
header:
COMMISSION DECISION of 30 November 1990 amending Decision 89/196/EEC, Euratom, ECSC laying down detailed rules for the declassification of documents covered by professional or business secrecy (90/631/Euratom, ECSC, EEC)
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN COMMUNITIES
main_body:
Article 1 of Commission Decision 89/196/EEC, Euratom, ECSC (3) is hereby replaced by the following:
"Article 1
For the purpose of applying Article 4 of Regulation (EEC, Euratom) No 354/83 or Article 4 of Commission Decision No 359/83/ECSC, the Commission shall publish a notice in the Official Journal of the European Communities to inform the persons or undertakings concerned that it intends to release to the public a document or a record covered by the obligation of professional or business secrecy and invite the person or undertaking concerned to submit any objections within a period of eight weeks.
If no objection is raised within this period, the document or record shall be released to the public."
This Decision shall apply with effect from 30 November 1990.
attachments:
Done at Brussels, 30 November 1990.
For the Commission
The President
Jacques DELORS  (1) OJ No L 43, 15.2.1983, p. 1. (2) OJ No L 43, 15.2.1983, p. 14. (3) OJ No L 73, 17.3.1989, p. 52.
